meanings.definition: A person who complains or expresses dissatisfaction.
meanings.sent1: The complainer in our group always finds something to be unhappy about.
meanings.sent2: The teacher listened patiently to the complainer's concerns.
meanings.sent3: The complainer at the restaurant was upset about the portion size of the meal.
meanings.sent4: She was known as the complainer of the office, always pointing out flaws.
meanings.sent5: The complainer's constant grumbling made the atmosphere tense.

meanings.definition: One who habitually grumbles or gripes.
meanings.sent1: My grandmother is a notorious complainer when it comes to the weather.
meanings.sent2: The complainer at the meeting seemed dissatisfied with every decision made.
meanings.sent3: The complainer's constant griping about the traffic became a running joke among friends.
meanings.sent4: He was such a complainer that even the smallest inconvenience would set him off.
meanings.sent5: The complainer's persistent grumbling wore down the patience of those around him.
